channel.title: Android saving some ints
channel.description: So in the android game lets say i have an int called number, by clicking a button that number will increase then lets say i clicked the button 9 times, now the number is 9, when i close the application the number will go zero again because in the onCreate method i have setted the int to be: number = 0; So basically i want the system to remember the last number, i think the only way doing this is using: FileInputStream & FileOutputStream, tell me how to save this

item.title: Android saving some ints

I learn java, what can i learn more i know most of the things… I am looking for an answer, and i do know what i am doing, i never coded android java before and that have some new methods i never code.
Edit:Its all work now, thank you bowser.

item.title: Android saving some ints
item.dc:creator: @Sup22211 Sup22211
item.description:
@Sup22211 wrote:

Yes, :
import android.content.SharedPreferences;
import android.app.;
import android.os.;
import android.view.;
import android.widget.;

public class MainActivity extends Activity{
int money = 10;

public static String fileName = “charFile”;
Button Dice;
TextView line;
TextView line2;

public void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState){
SharedPreferences settings = getSharedPreferences(fileName, 0);
int vmoney = settings.getInt("pMoney, money);

super.onCreate(savedInstanceState);
setContentView(R.layout.main);
Dice = (Button) findViewById(R.id.bDice);
line = (Button) findViewById(R.id.tLine);
line = (Button) findViewById(R.id.tLine2);
Dice.setOnClickListener(new View.OnClickListener(){
public void onClick(View v){
money+=25;
line2.setText("Money: "+money);

                    }
           });
   }

protected void onStop(){
SharedPreferences settings = getSharedPreferences(fileName, 0);
SharedPreferences.Editor editor = settings.edit();
editor.putInt("pMoney, money);
}
}

Read full topic

int money = 5;
then in the onCreate:
SharedPreferences settings = getSharedPreferences(fileName, 0);
int vmoney = settings.getInt(“pMoney” , money);
then onStop
SharedPreferences settings = getSharedPreferences(fileName, 0);
SharedPreferences.Editor editor = settings.edit();
editor.putInt("pMoney, money);
So that save the money int when i logout and login but it will only save the int (int money = 5;)[/quote]

item.title: Android saving some ints
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

Read from a file

[code=java]InputStream input = new FileInputStream(“log.txt”);

int data = input.read();
while(data != -1) {
//your stuff here e.g. method();
data = input.read();
}
input.close();[/code]

Write to file

[code=java]OutputStream output = new FileOutputStream(“log.txt”);

while(true) {
int number = 1;
output.write(number);
}
output.close();[/code]

try something less complicated

Read full topic

item.title: Android saving some ints
item.dc:creator: @Sup22211 Sup22211
item.description:
@Sup22211 wrote:

Yes but and i read something that this and this lines:
money = settings.getInt(“pMoney” , 0);
editor.putInt("pMoney, 0);
pMoney have to be the same because thats how it going to “read” and “save” the int and i thought 0 will be the default if i dont have a save one, so what to replace with 0? i dont think the money int because i said: money = settings.getInt(“pMoney” , 0);
Is this the right way adding this to be saved?
money = settings.getInt(“pMoney” , money);
editor.putInt("pMoney, money);

item.title: Android saving some ints
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

[quote=“Sup22211, post:11, topic:518495”]Ok, now its not giving errors
So its dont work, look what i did:
int money = 0;
public static String fileName = “charFile”;
in onCreate method
SharedPreferences settings = getSharedPreferences(fileName, 0);
money = settings.getInt(“pMoney” , 0);
Now onStop method
SharedPreferences settings = getSharedPreferences(fileName, 0);
SharedPreferences.Editor editor = settings.edit();
editor.putInt("pMoney, 0);
Now?[/quote]
Because you’re putting 0 back in for the saved value… Did you even look at the javadocs for this?
